Package soot.jimple.infoflow

Class AbstractInfoflow

  • java.lang.Object
    • soot.jimple.infoflow.AbstractInfoflow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IInfoflow, ITaintWrapperDataFlowAnalysis
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BackwardsInfoflow, Infoflow
    public abstract class AbstractInfoflow
extends Object
implements IInfoflow
    Abstract base class for all data/information flow analyses in FlowDroid
    Author:
    Steven Arzt

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractInfoflow

        public AbstractInfoflow()
        Creates a new instance of the abstract info flow problem

      • AbstractInfoflow

        public AbstractInfoflow​(BiDirICFGFactory icfgFactory,
                        String androidPath,
                        boolean forceAndroidJar)
        Creates a new instance of the abstract info flow problem
        Parameters:
        icfgFactory - The interprocedural CFG to be used by the InfoFlowProblem
        androidPath - If forceAndroidJar is false, this is the base directory of the platform files in the Android SDK. If forceAndroidJar is true, this is the full path of a single android.jar file.
        forceAndroidJar - True if a single platform JAR file shall be forced, false if Soot shall pick the appropriate platform version

      • computeInfoflow

        public void computeInfoflow​(String appPath,
                            String libPath,
                            IEntryPointCreator entryPointCreator,
                            List<String> sources,
                            List<String> sinks)
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        Computes the information flow on a list of entry point methods. This list is used to construct an artificial main method following the Android life cycle for all methods that are detected to be part of Android's application infrastructure (e.g. android.app.Activity.onCreate)
        Specified by:
        computeInfoflow in interface IInfoflow
        Parameters:
        appPath - The path containing the client program's files
        libPath - The path to the main folder of the (unpacked) library class files
        entryPointCreator - the entry point creator to use for generating the dummy main method
        sources - list of source class+method (as string conforms to SootMethod representation)
        sinks - list of sink class+method (as string conforms to SootMethod representation)

      • computeInfoflow

        public void computeInfoflow​(String appPath,
                            String libPath,
                            Collection<String> entryPoints,
                            Collection<String> sources,
                            Collection<String> sinks)
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        Computes the information flow on a list of entry point methods. This list is used to construct an artificial main method following the Android life cycle for all methods that are detected to be part of Android's application infrastructure (e.g. android.app.Activity.onCreate)
        Specified by:
        computeInfoflow in interface IInfoflow
        Parameters:
        appPath - The path containing the client program's files
        libPath - the path to the main folder of the (unpacked) library class files
        entryPoints - the entryPoints (string conforms to SootMethod representation)
        sources - list of source class+method (as string conforms to SootMethod representation)
        sinks - list of sink class+method (as string conforms to SootMethod representation)

      • computeInfoflow

        public void computeInfoflow​(String libPath,
                            String appPath,
                            String entryPoint,
                            Collection<String> sources,
                            Collection<String> sinks)
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        Computes the information flow on a single method. This method is directly taken as the entry point into the program, even if it is an instance method.
        Specified by:
        computeInfoflow in interface IInfoflow
        Parameters:
        libPath - The path containing the client program's files
        appPath - the path to the main folder of the (unpacked) library class files
        entryPoint - the main method to analyze
        sources - list of source class+method (as string conforms to SootMethod representation)
        sinks - list of sink class+method (as string conforms to SootMethod representation)

      • initializeSoot

        protected void initializeSoot​(String appPath,
                              String libPath,
                              Collection<String> classes)
        Initializes Soot.
        Parameters:
        appPath - The application path containing the analysis client
        libPath - The Soot classpath containing the libraries
        classes - The set of classes that shall be checked for data flow analysis seeds. All sources in these classes are used as seeds.

      • initializeSoot

        protected void initializeSoot​(String appPath,
                              String libPath,
                              Collection<String> classes,
                              String extraSeed)
        Initializes Soot.
        Parameters:
        appPath - The application path containing the analysis client
        libPath - The Soot classpath containing the libraries
        classes - The set of classes that shall be checked for data flow analysis seeds. All sources in these classes are used as seeds. If a non-empty extra seed is given, this one is used too.

      • computeInfoflow

        public void computeInfoflow​(String appPath,
                            String libPath,
                            IEntryPointCreator entryPointCreator,
                            ISourceSinkManager sourcesSinks)
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        Computes the information flow on a list of entry point methods. This list is used to construct an artificial main method following the Android life cycle for all methods that are detected to be part of Android's application infrastructure (e.g. android.app.Activity.onCreate)
        Specified by:
        computeInfoflow in interface IInfoflow
        Parameters:
        appPath - The path containing the client program's files
        libPath - the path to the main folder of the (unpacked) library class files
        entryPointCreator - the entry point creator to use for generating the dummy main method
        sourcesSinks - manager class for identifying sources and sinks in the source code

      • computeInfoflow

        public void computeInfoflow​(String appPath,
                            String libPath,
                            String entryPoint,
                            ISourceSinkManager sourcesSinks)
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        Computes the information flow on a single method. This method is directly taken as the entry point into the program, even if it is an instance method.
        Specified by:
        computeInfoflow in interface IInfoflow
        Parameters:
        appPath - The path containing the client program's files
        libPath - the path to the main folder of the (unpacked) library class files
        entryPoint - the main method to analyze
        sourcesSinks - manager class for identifying sources and sinks in the source code

                           Set<String> additionalSeeds)

        Parameters:
        sourcesSinks - The sources and sinks to be used
        additionalSeeds - Additional seeds at which to create A ZERO fact even if they are not sources

      • scanStmtForSourcesSinks

        protected abstract AbstractInfoflow.SourceOrSink scanStmtForSourcesSinks​(ISourceSinkManager sourcesSinks,
                                                                         soot.jimple.Stmt s)
        Checks whether the given statement is a source or a sink
        Parameters:
        sourcesSinks - The source/sink manager
        s - The statement to check
        Returns:
        An enumeration value that defines whether the given statement is a source, a sink, or neither

      • getMethodsForSeeds

        protected Collection<soot.SootMethod> getMethodsForSeeds​(IInfoflowCFG icfg)
        Given a callgraph, obtains all methods that may contain sources, i.e., statements that can serve as seeds for the taint propagation.
        Parameters:
        icfg - The interprocedural control flow graph
        Returns:
        The methods that may contain seeds

      • isValidSeedMethod

        protected boolean isValidSeedMethod​(soot.SootMethod sm)
        Gets whether the given method is a valid seen when scanning for sources and sinks. A method is a valid seed it it (or one of its transitive callees) can contain calls to source or sink methods.
        Parameters:
        sm - The method to check
        Returns:
        True if this method or one of its transitive callees can contain sources or sinks, otherwise false

      • isUserCodeClass

        protected boolean isUserCodeClass​(String className)
        Checks whether the given class is user code and should not be filtered out. By default, this method assumes that all code is potentially user code.
        Parameters:
        className - The name of the class to check
        Returns:
        True if the given class is user code, false otherwise

      • eliminateDeadCode

        protected void eliminateDeadCode​(ISourceSinkManager sourcesSinks)
        Runs all code optimizers
        Parameters:
        sourcesSinks - The SourceSinkManager

      • performCodeInstrumentation

        protected void performCodeInstrumentation​(InfoflowManager dceManager,
                                          Set<soot.SootMethod> excludedMethods)
        Allows subclasses to perform additional code instrumentation tasks
        Parameters:
        dceManager - The manager class for dead code elimination and instrumentation
        excludedMethods - The methods that shall not be modified

      • createDataFlowSolver

        protected IInfoflowSolver createDataFlowSolver​(InterruptableExecutor executor,
                                               AbstractInfoflowProblem problem)
        Creates the IFDS solver for the forward data flow problem
        Parameters:
        executor - The executor in which to run the tasks or propagating IFDS edges
        problem - The implementation of the forward problem
        Returns:
        The solver that solves the forward taint analysis problem

      • pathConfigToShorteningMode

        protected PredecessorShorteningMode pathConfigToShorteningMode​(InfoflowConfiguration.PathConfiguration pathConfiguration)
        Gets the path shortening mode that shall be applied given a certain path reconstruction configuration. This method computes the most aggressive path shortening that is possible without eliminating data that is necessary for the requested path reconstruction.
        Parameters:
        pathConfiguration - The path reconstruction configuration
        Returns:
        The computed path shortening mode

      • isResultAvailable

        public boolean isResultAvailable()
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        A result is available if the analysis has finished - so if this method returns false the analysis has not finished yet or was not started (e.g. no sources or sinks found)
        Specified by:
        isResultAvailable in interface IInfoflow
        Returns:
        boolean that states if a result is available
